alert.note: Alert for Fremont (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 21 at 4:06PM MDT until June 23 at 1:00PM MDT by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Riverton WY has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Wyoming... Wind River near Kinnear affecting Fremont County. For the Wind River Basin...including Red Creek, Dubois, Crowheart, Kinnear, Riverton...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON TO EARLY FRIDAY AFTERNOON... ...REPLACES RIVER FLOOD ADVISORY... * WHAT...Flooding is beginning to impact the Wind River bridge on Highway 132 near Kinnear. * WHERE...Wind River near Kinnear. * WHEN...From this afternoon to early Friday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 9.0 feet, Flood stage. Agricultural flooding along both banks becomes more widespread and intensifies. Water begins to encroach the north end of Highway 132. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:00 PM MDT Wednesday the stage was 9.0 feet. - Forecast...The river will remain near flood stage through Thursday afternoon. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Thursday morning at 600 AM MDT.
